name: Complete the HTML Structure
description: Fill in the blanks to complete the basic HTML structure, including the `<!DOCTYPE>`, `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>` tags.
hint: Ensure that all necessary tags are properly opened and closed.

name: Add an Image
description: Insert an image into the webpage using the `` tag. Fill in the `src` and `alt` attributes.
hint: Use the `` tag with `src` for the image source and `alt` for alternative text.

name: Create a Hyperlink
description: Create a hyperlink that navigates to `https://www.example.com`. Fill in the `href` attribute and link text.
hint: Use the `<a>` tag with the `href` attribute to create a clickable link.
boilerplate: <_____>

name: Create an Ordered List
description: Create an ordered list with three list items: First, Second, and Third.
hint: Use the `<ol>` tag for ordered lists and `<li>` tags for list items.
boilerplate:
1. <_____>

name: Create a Table
description: Create a table with two columns: Name and Age. Add two rows of data: Alice, 30 and Bob, 25.
hint: Use the `<table>`, `<tr>`, `<th>`, and `<td>` tags to structure the table.
boilerplate:
Name Age
<_____> <_____>
<_____> <_____>

name: Add a Form
description: Create a simple form with one text input for 'Name' and a submit button.
hint: Use the `<form>`, `<label>`, `<input>`, and `<button>` tags to build the form.
boilerplate:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Form Example</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Create your form below -->
    <form action="#" method="post">
      <label for="name">Name:</label>
      <input type="text" id="name" name="name" placeholder="<_____>">
      <button type="submit"><_____></button>
    </form>
  </body>
</html>

name: Use Semantic Tags
description: Replace the `<div>` tags with appropriate semantic HTML5 tags for header, main content, and footer.
hint: Use `<header>`, `<main>`, and `<footer>` tags to improve the semantic structure of the webpage.
boilerplate:
Welcome to My Website

This is the main content area.

© 2024 My Website

name: Embed a Video Element
description: Embed a video into the webpage using the `<video>` tag. Fill in the `src`, `controls`, and `width` attributes.
hint: Use the `<video>` tag with appropriate attributes to embed a video player.
boilerplate:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Video Element Example</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Embed your video below -->
    <video src="<_____>" controls width="<_____>">
      Your browser does not support the video tag.
    </video>
  </body>
</html>

name: Embed an Audio Element
description: Embed an audio file into the webpage using the `<audio>` tag. Fill in the `src` and `controls` attributes.
hint: Use the `<audio>` tag with the `src` attribute to specify the audio file and `controls` to display playback controls.
boilerplate:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Audio Element Example</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Embed your audio below -->
    <audio src="<_____>" controls>
      Your browser does not support the audio element.
    </audio>
  </body>
</html>

name: Add a Form with Validation
description: Create a form with two input fields: 'Email' and 'Password'. Add a submit button. Ensure the email field uses proper validation.
hint: Use the `<input>` type 'email' for email validation and 'password' for the password field.
boilerplate:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Form with Validation Example</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Create your form below -->
    <form action="#" method="post">
      <label for="email">Email:</label>
      <input type="<_____>" id="email" name="email" required>
      
      <label for="password">Password:</label>
      <input type="<_____>" id="password" name="password" required>
      
      <button type="submit"><_____></button>
    </form>
  </body>
</html>

name: Implement Responsive Design
description: Add a viewport meta tag to ensure the webpage is responsive on different devices.
hint: Use the `<meta>` tag with `name` set to `viewport` and appropriate `content` attributes.
boilerplate:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Responsive Design Example</title>
    <!-- Add the viewport meta tag below -->
    <meta <_____>="<_____>">
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Body content goes here -->
  </body>
</html>

name: Create a Footer with Social Links
description: Create a footer section that includes links to Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Use appropriate `<a>` tags within a `<footer>` element.
hint: Use the `<footer>` tag and nested `<a>` tags for social media links.
boilerplate: Facebook Twitter Instagram

name: Embed a Google Map
description: Embed a Google Map into the webpage using the `<iframe>` tag. Fill in the `src` and `width` attributes.
hint: Use the `<iframe>` tag with the `src` attribute pointing to the Google Maps URL and specify the `width` for sizing.
boilerplate:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Google Map Embed Example</title>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- Embed your Google Map below -->
    <iframe src="<_____>" width="<_____>" height="450" style="border:0;" allowfullscreen="" loading="lazy"></iframe>
  </body>
</html>
